direction.raw_text: Burritos...Enchiladas...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, gag, man, how can you eat that stuff?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't wait for fresh vegetables... Several voices suddenly break into argument..."vegetables?" "shit," "burgers"...Suddenly another voice rises above the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, cut the chatter.  You're not out of here, yet.  Who's the hook?  Seven?...You got a hook on container 22? A pause, then more voices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man's asking if you're hooked on 22, you dumb shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch your mouth, Sixpack.  Hello, Shack, Seven, here.  I ain't the hook, over. A light flares out of the darkness, suddenly illuminating an IMMENSE SHAPE--fifteen hundred pounds of hardened metal nearly seven feet tall.  It is a motorized diving suit and we see the stenciled name, WILLIE across the front breastplate.  As it pivots we see the stationary worklights around the base of a large underwater mining operation, THE SHACK.  Then a woman's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six to Shack.  I'm the hook. INSIDE THE SHACK/ CONTROL ROOM littered with papers, half-full coffee cups, and a confusion of wires and very low-tech, high-tech equipment BECK sits at the monitor controls.  He is younger than we expected, twenties, clean cut good looks.  He'll be a hell of a good- looking man at thirty-five, he just needs to be hardened. From the looks of the coffee cups around him he's on his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Six, let's wrap this container and call it a day. Above him a bank of monitor screens.  Each one labeled with a crew member's name and providing a video picture from a camera mounted on their helmet.  Beck reaches above him and throws a console switch which activates another monitor labeled ROV.  With a joystick he manipulates an outside camera(the ROV), its picture we see on the monitor.  It is moving. UNDERWATER WILLIE'S POV  The inside of her helmet is a grid of LED gauges monitoring air reserve, body temperature, atmospheres, heart rate, blood pressure. She stops next to a pair of railroad-like tracks and removes the tool attached to the end of her arm.  The move is practiced and professional, like a cook changing the tool on a set of egg beaters.  First, she inserts the existing tool into a lock on her opposite arm which holds it while she disengages the tool.  Next, she selects the next tool from the storage compartment at her waist and punches it into position.  Sixpack's voice comes over the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Willie, you trip on a tit or something?  We're all waiting on you, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep your pants on Sixpack. I promise you'll be inside before "Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood" comes on. OVER THE RADIO WE HEAR other men's voices laughing.  They like Willie and cheer her on.  "Tell him, Willie," "Atta girl," etc... Willie CLICKS in her last tool and turns.  Expertly she hooks a large dumpster-like container, the container to what looks like an underwater parachute--A CONTAINER TRANSPORTER--which when filled with oxygen it lifts the massive container onto the tracks where it can be hauled-in by a winch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six to Shack...Hook's on.  Ready to winch. UNDERWATER MACHINERY Halogen lights illuminate bits and pieces of dredges and dumpsters squatting in the gloom.  A winch begins grinding and the big, newly hooked container lurches down the tracks. It comes to the end where a winch fits it into place with several others to complete a set.  We hear BECK'S VOICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok, that's it.  Come on in. More motor suited DIVERS appear, their helmet lights glaring.  Their breastplate names catch in the dim lights: COBS, BOWMAN, WILLIE. As they approach the UNDERWATER LOCK, where an elevator will transport them up into the Shack, we see signs of human life:  a basketball goal attached to the side of the building; stickers and signs:  "No Bozos," etc.  A formal sign towers over the entrance.  It says: TRANSOCEAN CORP. SHACK 6. ON ONE OF THE CREW He moves behind the others.  Suddenly he freezes in his tracks and slowly rotates his helmet--on his shoulder in the glare of his helmet beam WE SEE the a hideous looking SEA SPIDER.  It's thick legs moving eerily down his arm. Carefully, so as not to disturb the creature, a mechanical motor hand moves into position below it, and in one quick movement, snares it. CLOSE ON METAL WAIST POCKET.  The latch opens and the writhing sea spider is shoved inside.  From the pocket WE MOVE UP the diver's suit until we see the name SIXPACK on the breastplate.  He looks around to see if anyone has noticed then continues on toward the shack. ON TWO DIVERS(JONES AND DEJESUS) They walk together to the Shack.  A Latino VOICE, DEJESUS, comes over the radio singing an old Miller Beer jingle in an exaggerated accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When it's time to relax.... One thing stands clear... INSIDE ON BECK As he listens to the singing over the tinny speaker, we see he aches to be a part of their comaraderie, but is alienated by age and rank.  He is the shack boss, management.  He listens as a BOOMING BLACK VOICE joins in off-key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mil-ler's tastes too good to hurry through... As the singing continues, Beck looks over at an empty chair in front of a bank of equipment monitors.  The vital signs of each miner and his equipment are registered on this console.  The chair in front of them sits conspicuously empty.  This doesn't please Beck, neither does a hand written sign under the console which states:  THE DOCTOR IS OUT . DEJESUS' POV Inside his helmet we see the grid of LED gauges monitoring vital signs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...beer after beer... Suddenly a red warning light begins blinking in the bottom corner inside DeJesus' helmet.  The words to the song freeze in his mouth.  His voice becomes edged with panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Hazy, I'm not that bad, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonesy!  I'm losing compression... I'm going to blow my suit, man! Beck!  Doc!  Help me!... INSIDE Beck grabs his microphone.  He tries to remain calm but there is a definite tremble in his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a readout, DeJesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhhh! OUTSIDE The other divers move quickly to DeJesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DeJesus!  A readout!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He don't need a readout, man, he needs help!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay calm!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm!?  Where's Doc? INSIDE Beck stands in front of the equipment monitors, lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The internal monitors read normal. ON THE MINERS, PANICKED
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Doc?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not at his station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, mother of Jesus, forgive me of my--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get him into the Shack. DeJesus' gauges begins a countdown to implosion.  "15, 14, 13..."  DeJesus is grabbed by his co-workers and hurried the last few yards to the SHACK. INSIDE/SHACK - SAME ON BECK  sweating bullets, turns a dial on the instruments and suddenly, DeJesus' gauges jump to life.  We see the same countdown in progress on the Shack's gauges!..10, 9, 8... OUTSIDE ON DEJESUS  He is forced into the LOCK, the underwater elevator room is eerily lit.  His readout continues inside his helmet...5, 4, 3...DeJesus screams. ON BECK DeJesus' scream comes over his radio in the control room. Beck hits the elevator switch--nothing happens.  He hits it again harder and suddenly DeJesus voice is drowned out by the SCREAMING VACUUM PUMPS of the elevator.  It's moving! Beck looks up at the monitor of the interior Lift Lock. INSIDE/LIFT LOCK WE SEE DeJESUS'S SUIT dripping wet.  It stands inside the Lift Lock, ankle deep in greasy bilge water. CLOSE ON HIS EYES, for a moment they remain closed, then suddenly they flutter.  He's alive! THE MESS - LATER The blackboard prominently displayed on the wall of the Mess features neatly stenciled letters that say:  "DAYS TILL PICKUP".  The number scrawled on the chalk-smudged board obviously changes daily.  Right now, it's a "3"... A CLUNK, CLUNK and a Coke can rolls out of a compact COKE MACHINE.  A big, sandy-haired man, SIXPACK, takes the soft drink, pops the top and downs it in one long pull while he looks over an arguing group of deep sea miners:  JONES, Black, athletic, 30's;  COBB, 50's, a career miner with a mouthful of gum;  BOWMAN, 35, attractive, hardened woman, she has seen more of the world than any of them;  WILLIE, twenties, fresh good looks, master electrician, optimist. DEJESUS, Latino, wiry muscles, he keeps his head down, still shaken from his experience. The strain of a month of working two miles beneath the ocean's surface has drawn nerves tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you, it's the suits!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck the suits, it's the people monitoring them.  It Doc had been there like he's supposed to it never would've happened!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And just what the fuck would he have done to stop it, huh? Sixpack looks over the group, then suddenly crushes the empty Coke can in his hand, punctuating the action with a huge belch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would have been you, DeJesus... DeJesus keeps his head down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...I was standing next to a guy who blew a suit once in the Indian Ocean...little tiny hole in the fucking toe of his suit ...ocean came in and the pressure crammed his whole fucking body up into his helmet. They just buried his helmet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know all about implosion, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I bet you do. (laughs) I bet you were imploding in your pants. (laughs then imitates a hysterical DeJesus) Jonesy!  Doc!...Help me!  Help me! DeJesus springs for Sixpack's throat AS WE CUT TO BECK - SAME Beck's eyes are blazing with cold authority as he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knock it off, Sixpack!  I know it's been a long month for every- one, but we can't let something like this tear us apart... Beck glares, ready for an argument, but as WE PULL BACK we see he's talking to the mirror, in his tiny quarters. Apparently he fails to convince himself because his hard look fades and he mutters unhappily as he turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit... He turns around to face a smiling picture of himself at college graduation with his Eastern establishment looking father.  Leadership "how-to" books like The One Minute Manager , etc. line his bookshelf with technical manuals on underwater mining. He opens his door to leave when SUDDENLY A LOUD METALLIC GROANING NOISE stops him cold.  The entire Shack seems shifting, like a giant waking from a nap. MESS The NOISE stops the fight between DeJesus and Sixpack cold. All eyes go to the ceiling and walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck the suits man...this place is going to kill us first. Just as suddenly as it began the GROANING NOISE STOPS and in its place WE HEAR an intermittent RATTLE in the air system. Only Cobb seems undisturbed by this sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There it is again... (sitting down again) Two more days.  I tell myself 'you can make it two more days--'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the weather like up top?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clear for pickup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's hope it holds. Cobb looks up disgustingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what?  Huh? (to everyone) Then what?  You folks think going up top's the answer to all your problems.  Well, it ain't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give us a break, Cobb...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A break?  You folks don't need a break, you need psychiatrists.  'Know what you'd be doing if you were up there, right now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eating pussy and drinking brew...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eating pussy my ass.  What about lines at the bank:  What about getting stuck in traffic?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wherever I can find it. Everyone laughs but Cobb, WE SEE he's serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit!  I'll tell you what you'd be doing!  You'd be watching news on TV that's so fucking bad it makes you nauseous.  So you go out and get in your car to get some fresh air and after you've been driving for five minutes you realize the air's so damn dirty you don't dare breath it!  That's what you've got to look forward to... LOWER RING CORRIDOR Beck approaches the Mess and as he nears it we hear Cobb ranting inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...And if you're lucky enough to make it back home to your house that looks the fucking same as everyone else's, you'll find your wife's just as fat as she was when you left and the only reason your kids ain't strung out on the drugs they were using when you left is that they've found some new drugs which fuck 'em up even more!... You people just don't appreciate how good you've got down here... BECK hesitates at the door to the Mess, as though screwing up his courage, then takes a deep breath and enters as we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone looks up as Beck enters and the room goes quiet. Beck notices Doc's empty chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doc eat already?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The good doctor hasn't showed yet. Looks are exchanged.  Sixpack smirks knowingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you feel, DeJesus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better let the Doc take a look at you, after dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, since he was busy earlier when you needed him. He cracks up and Beck turns on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut it, Sixpack. Sixpack shuts up, but Beck notices the others feel the seriousness of Doc's absence during the emergency.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave the Doc to me.  I'm going to talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Makes me feel better already... Beck gets his tray but it is clear he is thinking about something else.  He clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been looking at the duty roster...at the shack hours outstanding...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, oh...I see where this is going...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...all of you owe time and I thought tonight would be a good time to---
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way, Mister Beck! No fucking way !  We just did a full shift, you can't call Shack duty on top of a full shift.  It's a contract violation!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whooo!  Right on, Cobb!  Let's hear it for our shop Steward!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear that Becky, er, Mr. Beck? Company got to abide by the rules. FIVE FACES STARE AT BECK.  THEY'RE LOOKING FOR WEAKNESS. THIS IS A CHALLENGE TO HIS AUTHORITY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know all about the contract. The point is you can follow the goddamn contract to the letter and pull your shack duty tomorrow...or you can get it done tonight and call tomorrow a down day.  It's up to you. This leaves the group momentarily speechless.  Even DeJesus comes out of his stupor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You giving us a day off? Beck nods.  Cobb eyes him suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about our quota?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're only twenty-five tons off quota.  Barring an unforeseen problem you should reach it easily on the last day. (he looks at the group) It's just a day off.  You don't have to take it, I just thought it might help. The others look around for agreement but Jones doesn't need anyone else's approval, he's already made up his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Count me in. Bowman nods her head also and the others unanimously agree. Buoyed, Beck moves ahead, businesslike...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cobb, Jones, I want you to do something about that damn rattle in the air system... (to Bowman and Sixpack) Bowman and Sixpack...living quarters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Williams...get DeJesus' suit on the "sick rack" and do a diagnostics. (to group) Any other suit problems she should know about? Sixpack suddenly looks up as the group disperses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My pocket.  Check my pocket, will ya, honey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your pocket?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The latch is screwed up.  Or the hinge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. LOWER RING CORRIDOR - SAME ON BECK  He starts out of the Mess and by chance finds himself walking with Willie.  Beck is obviously uncomfortable with the crew, even after 28 days together. She smiles, friendly, at ease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did good...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today...with DeJesus.  That was smart thinking to get him inside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There probably wasn't anything wrong with his suit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still...you did the right thing. She turns off toward the Swamp, leaving Beck with the tiny, but honest compliment.  He savors it. THE SWAMP - LATER The "Swamp" (where DeJesus came up), is ankle deep in greasy bilgewater.  The door slides open, Willie enters, and switches on a bank of fluorescent lights.  The room is spooky even with the lights.  The giant machine suits, we saw earlier outside, hang from racks like sleeping monsters. Willie straps on a utility belt and checks her tools--a motorized screwdriver, a power wrench, a long-necked, laser-tipped soldering iron(looks like a long-necked screwdriver)--then splashes through the bilge water to the control switch and hits the START button. NNNNNNNNNN.  A motor moves one of the suits along the track toward Willie.  As it turns the corner toward us we see it says:  DEJESUS. DOC'S OFFICE - SAME Beck opens the door to Doc's quarters and we see Doc putting on a fresh shirt.  A man in his 50's, he must have once been quite handsome and intelligent, but has now gone to seed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must have dozed off. Beck looks on the cabinet and sees a bottle of Old Granddad Whiskey.  He picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snakebite medicine...Never pack my bag without it. Beck doesn't smile.  He puts the bottle back down and Doc watches him in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you planning on working tomorrow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'll be on the golf course in the morning.  Then, if I don't have any babies to deliver--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We almost had an accident today. DeJesus' suit... The Doc stops buttoning his shirt and locks eyes with Beck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got something to say to me, son?... Beck definitely has something to say, but confronted, he falters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I think it's important to have the second officer on deck. Doc smiles, and goes back to buttoning his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll keep it to nine holes in the morning. THE DORMITORY - SAME Small but functional.  The bunks can be closed-off with a privacy door.  Photographs and bumper stickers on the walls of the bunks provide the only personal touches in an otherwise sterile environment. Willie's bunk is wallpapered in detailed interplanetary maps;  Sixpack's privacy door has a bumper sticker which proclaims:  "I MAY BE FAT, BUT YOU'RE UGLY AND I CAN DIET." DeJesus' has posters of the Alps, and the Rockies;  Bowman's has clipped pages from "Gourmet" of meals she dreams for; Cobb's has nothing, as if perfectly content to be where he is instead of somewhere else.  Inside Jones' bunk is an indoor basketball goal. Bowman and Sixpack scrub down the walls of the dorm with a sponge and pail.  Sixpack pauses and smirks, his eyes on Bowman's chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ...what a pair...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that?  What'd you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said, "What a pair" the boy wonder Shack Boss and his drunken doctor buddy make... (innocently) Why?  What did ya think I said? CORRIDOR "A" - SAME Jones and Cobb are kneeling in a corridor, unfastening a big plate on the floor with a power wrench.  Overhead a huge plexiglass conduit flows with water from the desalinization system.  The interior wall of the corridor is meshed wire exposing the throbbing machine floor of the Shack. Cobb removes the last bolt and Jones lifts off the floorplate exposing the guts of the shack--the BILGE--dark and wet.  Without the plate the RATTLE in the air system is much louder and sinister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to it for Christsake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, it's just old, like me. You don't see the Doc opening me up every time I get a new creak in my joints...I say, as long as it's recycling the air let the next shift deal with it. But, 'long as we're here... He pulls a retractable ladder from inside the hole and drops it down into the wet darkness, without hesitating he climbs down, stopping at the bottom to look up at Jones.  Jones seems in no hurry to accompany him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna sit there on your butt or give me a hand? Jones reluctantly starts down after him. BECK'S QUARTERS - SAME Beck in his quarters.  He seems to be talking to himself but as we move around him we see he is talking to a video monitor.  On screen we see MARTIN, 30's, a slick bureaucratic executive with TransOcean Corp. whose face is all we see on the video monitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two hundred and fifty-two tons of Magnesium and 15 tons of Sodium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like a good week, Beck. In fact...I put your folder in front of the Vice President of District Operations last night... Beck stops.  Martin notices his concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're good executive timber, Beck.  A lot of management trainees wash out when they have to go under for their first tour.  But you've done well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Martin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't thank me, yet, but it is important to know where you're going and who your friends are... 'Know what I mean? He stares hard at Beck, but doesn't wait for an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one thing I've learned in this company is you can't have enough friends.  It's the only way to survive. CLOSE ON A BOOM BOX/ LOWER RING CORRIDOR - SAME The boom box sitting on a wall pipe is blaring John Denver's Rocky Mountain High. DeJesus is singing along loudly in his thick accent as he works on the intercom system.  He finishes, closing a metal box which says:  ONBOARD COMMUNICATIONS. SWAMP - SAME ON WILLIE  She has connected DeJesus' suit to the diagnostic computer and is going through the computerized checkpoints--an electronic list of literally hundreds of possible problems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably a short. Suddenly, the computer pauses on one:  It says:  Electrical Short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good guess, Williams. She types in a "help" command and the computer screen displays an electrical circuit pattern that would leave most Electrical Engineers baffled.  Willie hardly bats an eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piece of cake. She immediately opens the circuit panel on DeJesus' suit and pulls the laser soldering iron out of her tool belt.  With two quick spot welds she repairs the short, then replaces the panel.  Finished, Willie presses the control switch and the suits begin to move along the track.  A new suit rounds the corner toward us.  It says SIXPACK. THE BILGE - SAME The walls are dark and moist.  Water drips from the pipes. The rattle in the air system continues loudly as Jones leans over and hands Cobb another tool.  Crouched in the humming machinery, Cobb spits his wad of chewing gum into a greasy hand, kneads it a couple of times, then grins at Jones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, watch this.. THE SWAMP - SAME The monotonous clatter of the air system is the only sound in the gloomy SWAMP as the huge suit labeled SIXPACK stops directly in front of Willie.  She reaches up to open the pocket latch when she stops...listening.  THE NOISE IN THE AIR SYSTEM HAS STOPPED. THE BILGE - SAME Jones looks incredulously at Cobb.  He can't believe that's all it took.  Cobb starts gathering up the tools.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's all you do?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhhh...don't tell no one. (winks) Job security. THE SWAMP - SAME In the gloomy silence, Willie reaches for the hinged pocket in the waist of Sixpack's suit.  Some water drips out.  She pushes the spring a second time.  The pocket opens. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing wrong with this... SUDDENLY THE HIDEOUS SEA SPIDER SPRINGS OUT onto the workbench where it wriggles grotesquely toward Willie.  She backs away and it drops into the water at her feet. THE DORMITORY Bowman looks at DeJesus who comes to the door, then to Sixpack who convulses with laughter against the bulkhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you, Sixpack!  You think you're funny?  You're not funny! ON BECK He hesitates then presses the TALK button on the intercom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Beck.  Is there a problem, Williams? SWAMP Willie watches the Sea Spider move in the water toward her as Beck's words come over the P.A.  Ignoring Beck she watches the spider right as it moves to her feet then brings the soldering iron down into the water with a LOUD HISS skewering it.  She presses the intercom button and lifts the skewered sea spider out of the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little problem, sir...but I've got a handle on it now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Made your million, yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's TransOcean doing? This causes Bowman to turn and look at Willie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got money in this tub?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I signed-up for the stock option. Bowman shakes her head and goes back to the computer and types in TransOcean Corp. DORMITORY ON COBB  He lies on his bunk under a sunlamp, but wears a T-shirt and long pants.  DeJesus does a jigsaw puzzle of a snow covered Swiss mountain scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, man, you know that in Switzerland--and this country's the size of East L.A., okay?--they speak 54 different dialects? Fifty-four!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who cares?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do, man.  That's a beautiful place.  When I get out of here I'm going there.  Find a nice little snow covered chalet, warm little woman, crackling fire-- He looks up and sees Cobb's sunbathing attire and laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Cobb...Man, why don't you take off your shirt and pants, man?  You should do that wearing what you're going to wear at the beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what I wear at the beach, goddamnit. MESS - SAME COMPUTER SCREEN  The report appears on screen with a capsulized history of the TransOcean company, its philosophy and growth plans and most current financial report.  A final column called "insider tips" says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Major development in South Indian Ocean set for fall of 2010..." (to Willie) That sounds interesting, but they're too tied to their holdings.  Remember a year ago when they lost that tanker?... The bottom fell out of their stock and I lost a bloody fortune.  That's when I decided to diversify. Willie looks at Bowman a moment, then keeps exercising.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take your money, too seriously, Bo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're damn right I do.  Five years down here and I'll pull in more than 15 topside.  I'm not down here for the fun, I'll tell you that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Fun?"  Somebody talking fun? They look up to see Sixpack at the door to the Mess wearing only a robe.  With a leer he stares at Willie exercising.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Willie, honey...Sorry about that little incident tonight...Everyone's been so tight lately, I thought a little humor'd loosen us all up, you know? Willie doesn't bite, she looks hard at Sixpack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of here, Sixpack. Sixpack smirks.  He waves a copy of Penthouse opened to the Pet of the Month and sings cheerfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a date with an angel... CLANK, BANK, CLUNK.  A coke can tumbles noisily from the Coke machine.  Jones retrieves two cans of Coke and comes out of the Galley with a snack.  He stops in front of Bowman and the computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Bo...when're you going to be off that thing?  I want to find out tonight's NBA scores and check the weather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The weather's good, I already checked, but I'll be off in a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Jonesy, who's the best power forward in the NBA...Jameson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jameson?  Who're you trying to con? They grin at each other--a standing joke and Jones leaves. DORMITORY Jones enters the Dorm with his snack and tosses a can of Coke across the room to DeJesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Hazy!  We got a day off tomorrow, Kemosabi!  Let's get shit-faced! DEJESUS catches the can and pops the top sending a shower of carbonation all over Cobb under the sunlamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about you, brother Cobb? Little Wild Turkey? Cobb wipes the Coke from his sunglasses and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, man, Cobb is a Chivas drinker, from way back.  Ain't that right Cobbie? Jones and DeJesus laugh and take long pulls on their Cokes. Cobb turns and watches them.  This is obviously a nightly ritual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys are crazy.  What the hell you play that stupid game for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What game, Cobb?...I'm on my way to Nirvana...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're on your way somewhere all right...the looney bin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on the way to the looney bin?  Hey, man, I'm not the dude sun bathing in his clothes. INT. SIXPACK'S BUNK - SAME CLOSE ON  The Pet of the Month as she smirks coyly from the centerfold, her body twisted into an awkward position representing mad desire. Sixpack closes his privacy door then smirks back at the photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Darlin'...come sit on my face... He stirs in the bed and adjusts his pillow and SCREAMS!  The SEA SPIDER is suddenly right there on his shoulder, dead. Sixpack sits bolt upright in his bunk and slams his head against the roof of the bunk, then stumbles out screaming. He hits the floor and rams his foot into a table and screams in more pain. The whole dorm looks up amazed, Cobb takes off his sunglasses, even Jones and DeJesus temporarily "sober up" to stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That bitch! MESS Sixpack storms into the Mess with the dead Sea Spider.  He points angrily at his bleeding foot.  Jones and DeJesus move up to watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bitch!  Look what you did!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, darling...Just thought a little humor would loosen us all up...you know?... Everyone laughs, but Sixpack.  He has revenge in his eyes. He holds out the ugly, limp creature and advances toward Willie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you're so funny? Wait till you taste this! As he pushes the dead creature into her face BECK'S VOICE behind him makes him freeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough! Everybody turns to see Beck standing in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at my foot, sir!  This bitch put a goddamn sea monster in my bunk!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know it was Williams?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?  I...uh...uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, Sixpack, you and Williams are gonna pull water duty tomorrow--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit!  What?!  She...He...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At ease!  You both have a half day...Anymore shit and its a full one. CLOSE ON BLACKBOARD/ MESS - MORNING SCREECH!  Chalk on the blackboard as Bowman writes "2" in place of yesterday's "3" over the neatly lettered words "Days Till Pickup." Jones, sitting next to Cobb, looks up from his tray of cereal and holds his head in mock misery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oooooh.  Damn!  Not so loud. Turn down the music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What music?  There ain't no music. DeJesus enters holding his head and sits on the other side of Cobb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oooooh. Cobb looks from one man to the other, realizing what they're doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know it's really crazy to pretend to be drunk, but it's fucking insane to pretend to have a hangover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your "hangovers" made you miss the Sixpack Good Morning Show. (imitating Sixpack) "No goddamn boy is going to make me go out on a down day."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?  How'd the kid hold up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty good.  He sent them out videotaping outcrop. UNDERWATER - SAME CLOSE ON  A whirling cylinder tool we see is attached to the end of Willie's mechanical suit arm.  Like a drill its diamond bits cut into the rock outcrop to take a core sample.  It's a sinister hand-attachment, something Captain Hook would have loved. Above her the ROV maneuvers into position for a better view. INSIDE THE SHACK CONTROL - SAME Beck is in the control station, staring at the video monitors--the image from the ROV.  Willie removes a slender instrument, like a bicycle pump and with a quick pump motion, CHUNK, CHUNK...activates an explosive charge.  She puts it into the hole she made with the drill and backs off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charge set?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charge set.  Backing off. (to the ROV) C'mon Rover let's get out of here. Like a good dog, the ROV follows her to a safe position. ON MONITOR  THE CAMERA HOLDS ON THE SPOT.  SUDDENLY THE GROUND SHAKES VIOLENTLY ON THE MONITOR SCREEN--A MINI EARTHQUAKE CHARGE. WILLIE RETURNS TO THE SITE OF THE CHARGE AND REINSERTS HER DRILL, EASILY REMOVING A TEST SAMPLE. Willie holds out the sample to the ROV so Beck can see inside. INT. CONTROL ROOM/ CLOSE ON BECK'S ROV MONITOR He stares at the image on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need more light on that, Four. OUTSIDE WILLIE (to Beck) Roger... (to Sixpack) More light, Sixpack... There is no answer.  Willie turns around.  Her helmet lamp eerily illuminating the darkness around her.  Sixpack is nowhere to be seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixpack? She turns in the other direction and suddenly blinding lights are turned on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boo! Sixpack laughs.  His lights now on, he stands right behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shit....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on, Four?  What's happening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're fine, Shack.  His lights malfunctioned for a minute.  How's this? She again holds out her hand to the ROV. INSIDE SHACK Beck looks at the monitor and presses a red button to start the tape, then after five seconds releases the button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's great.  Now let's move
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: degrees southwest. WILLIE AND SIXPACK MOVING WILLIE (to Sixpack) You screw around like that again and--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong, did you miss me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hardly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, darlin, I'm... Suddenly Sixpack's foot hits some loose rock and slides. Willie turns in his direction and sees his headlight turning, becoming smaller, then disappearing as his radio goes dead. INSIDE ON BECK BECK What's wrong?!  What happened? UNDERWATER ON WILLIE  She has stopped in her tracks.  All around her is blackness.  Her helmet light hardly penetrates the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixpack?!  Sixpack... Then she looks down--a cliff right in front of her feet. The drop is thirty feet into a waving sea of tubers. BECK'S VOICE brings Willie back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie?  What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gone.  I think he's fallen.  I'm going down after him. MESS Jones is bench pressing 200 pounds on a fold-down compact gym, while DeJesus huffs and puffs on an exercise bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it Jonesy...Sweat it out, man...Got to get the poison out of our blood. Jones grits his teeth and struggles against the weight, suddenly Bowman throws open the door and sticks her head in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixpack is lost. CORRIDOR - MOMENTS LATER Bowman, Jones and DeJesus are heading for the control room where they are joined by Cobb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weren't they tied?  They're supposed to be tied. They all enter the CONTROL ROOM Beck is at the console with Doc in his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far away is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two hundred meters. WILLIE'S VOICE silences them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four to Shack...nearing the bottom.  Look at this... They all stare at the monitor.  The screen is filled with huge waving tubers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, look at the size of those tubers....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nine, ten feet high...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he had his blinkers on--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wouldn't make any difference in there...He could be two feet away and on fire and she'd still not see him! UNDERWATER ON WILLIE  She moves through the dense waving forest of giant tubers, parting them with her hands as she moves slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixpack? CONTROL ROOM BECK Why can't we pick up his signal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he got eaten?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would be dumb enough to eat Sixpack? ON WILLIE She moves aside the last of the tubers and freezes at the sight in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four to Shack...you picking this up? INSIDE All eyes suddenly go to the monitor.  A huge dark maw fills the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Affirmative...Widening picture. The image on the screen widens and we see the opening is a huge gash in the side of a sunken ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tighten the picture on the upper righthand corner. CLOSE ON THE MONITOR:  The picture zooms in on the corner and Willie's added light suddenly brings the letter "M" into focus. Beck presses the red record button and pans the ROV slowly across the bulkhead of the ship.  The next letter is an "A". Then suddenly a Cyrillic letter appears, then others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your air reading?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty minutes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty minutes!...Who had tank duty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who else...Sixpack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man is unbelievable... I say, leave him in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about his suit?  That's a million five the company's got to replace.  They'll make somebody go get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Willie, we're giving you five minutes...after that we're coming in. WILLIE'S POV Her life-support gauges move eerily around the perimeter of her mask.  She moves along steadily down darkened corridors. She opens a door and it drops from its corroded hinges--a cloud of sludge rises off the bottom.  The room looks empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixpack?...Answer me. She throws open another door.  It also looks empty, then WHAM! a grotesque ECHONODERM slams into her helmet.  Willie bats it aside and as soon as she recovers shines her light into the room. WHAT SHE SEES:  The ship's infirmary.  Broken glass, stainless steel...the light does strange things, reflecting, sparkling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The infirmary...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three minutes... Her helmet-mounted camera pans the room one more time, then as she turns to leave it captures a strange gleam of white in the corner--A LARGE HUMAN-LIKE SKELETON.  Willie doesn't see it. INT. THE CONTROL ROOM CLOSE ON DOC  He stares at the monitor screen.  Did he see something or were his eyes playing tricks?  He looks across the console and sees the videotape is recording. UNDERWATER ON WILLIE  She moves to the end of the hall.  It ends with two doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One minute. Willie hesitates at the junction and PUSHES OPEN the door on her left, SOMETHING HUGE BEHIND IT MOVES--IT'S SIXPACK.  His mechanical arms suddenly rise and in their grasp we see the ship's huge safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm rich, honey.  Rich! THE SWAMP - LATER The door to the Russian ship's safe stands open.  BANG! BANG!  Jones and DeJesus hammer safety deposit boxes with a chisel.  While the others watch, Sixpack pleads his case with Beck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all mine if I'm on report. Otherwise you gotta take me off report before you look at any more... Ain't that right, Cobbie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're on your own, Sixpack, you fucked up everybody's day off... DeJesus pries off the top from the first safety deposit box and dumps the contents on the workbench...several wallets, wristwatches, a pocket watch, a wedding ring...Bowman who stands with a clipboard begins taking inventory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Personal effects...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Timex... She picks up something else, a pack of soggy chewing gum and tosses it to Cobb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's something for you, Cobbie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russian money...Don't look like much. Jones opens the next box and dumps it out onto the table...Life Savers candy, a postcard of a fat Russian woman in a bathing suit.  Bowman looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'd say you can retire with all this loot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up. Everyone chuckles.  More papers and a small, book-shaped object wrapped in plastic.  Jones unwraps it.  It's a video tape.  He looks at the label.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Debbie Does Dallas"... (looks up and grins) Hell, it's in Russian.  I can't read it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I see it? Jones hands it to Doc who looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a log of some sort. Jones pries the lid off another box and dumps it out--Papers, more cheap watches. ON SIXPACK  He notices something silver, the size of a paperback book, under a stack of papers.  Discreetly he covers the object with a piece of paper and slides it off the table out of sight. Jones opens the last box, and something rolls across the table toward the edge and starts to drop when it is caught by DeJesus.  He holds it up and we see--a clear liquor bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What assholes, they lock booze in the safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably confiscated.  No booze on board, same as us. Doc turns the bottle around in DeJesus' hand so he can read the label.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stolichnaya. Everyone looks at Doc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You read Russian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russian, French, Italian, Spanish, Greek, German, a little Hindu, some Serbo Croat and a smattering of Swahili...standard pre-med background... Cobb stares at him a second then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and a Russian grandmother... Beck ignores them and addresses Bowman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want all this stuff impounded in the supply safe. He lifts the bottle of Stolie out of DeJesus' hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...except this...it goes in my safe. A disappointed crew watches Beck leave with the bottle.  Doc stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mind if I take a look at this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be my guest. RING CORRIDOR - LATER The gloomy corridor outside the Infirmary.  It is empty, silent.  Suddenly the door to the Infirmary opens slightly and Bowman peeks out.  Seeing the corridor is empty she slips out with a a manila folder. DORMITORY - SAME Bowman hands the envelope to DeJesus, who's grinning delightedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got 'em! Sixpack and Jones are there too.  Sixpack scowls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What good's the kid's med records anyway!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch and learn, amigo... CONTROL ROOM - LATER CLOSE ON MONITOR SCREEN We see a thin, bearded man in his late fifties, a RUSSIAN SHIP'S CAPTAIN talking to the camera in Russian.  The tape is of poor quality and water spotted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another party last night.  More Vodka.  The infirmary is filled as it is.  I confiscate what I can, but I know the Government Observers have more... Suddenly, the captain hears a noise off-screen and goes to the camera and turns it off.  The tape goes blank. ON DOC He stops the tape and presses another button on the console. WILLIE'S VIDEO of the huge hole in the hull of the ship appears on another screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See that gash?  The way the edges protrude inward is like from a torpedo explosion.  It couldn't have come from within. Like an accident. He looks back at Beck who we see is sitting behind him, and has also been watching the tape.  Beck looks at Doc and shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want me to say? That it all sounds mysterious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These observers were doing something. A test...I think they sank that ship on purpose to cover up their mistakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What mistakes? (he shakes his head wearily) Look, I think it's no big deal but if you want to find out why this ship sank have Maritime run a check. He gets up and goes to the door.  Doc watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did.  They have no record of the wreck. (beat) The Marshal Goloviev is now on a tour in the Baltic Sea. Beck stops.  This is a mystery. CLOSE ON COMBINATION LOCK/ BECK'S QUARTERS - SAME Fingers fiddle with the combination.  He pulls on the handle.  The safe doesn't budge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not the phone number... We pull back to see that DeJesus is alone in Beck's darkened quarters, he talks to the P.A.  Suddenly we hear BOWMAN'S VOICE over the intercom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, try the social security number... DeJesus puts his fingers back, on the safe dial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, give it to me... INTERCUT WITH BOWMAN IN DORM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two...twelve...ninety-six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys are so full of shit... Who's going to use their birthday...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like I said, that bottle's mine! CONTROL ROOM - SAME ON Beck at the door and Doc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want your permission to check that vodka. Beck looks at him.  It is obvious that he doesn't trust Doc, with the vodka, but he's diplomatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a mining shack, not a lab, Doc.  If there's something strange with the vodka it's safe till we get back. UPPER RING CORRIDOR ON COBB  Standing watch for DeJesus.  Suddenly the door to the Control room opens and Beck walks out.  Cobb grabs a walkie-talkie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beck's coming. BECK'S QUARTERS/ ON DEJESUS He hears Cobb and freezes.  He looks around--the cramped quarters don't offer much in the way of hiding places. INTERCUT WITH BOWMAN AND OTHERS IN DORMATORY They react similarly to the sound of Cobb on the P.A. ON COBB AND BECK/ CORRIDOR Beck stops outside his door and sees Cobb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something wrong, Cobb?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh..Excuse me sir, it's the air recirculating system, sir...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'd really have to show it to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right... Cobb smiles, he can't believe his luck, then Beck holds up the videotape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Just let me put this in my safe... Before Cobb can react Beck opens the door to his quarters and steps inside. BECK'S QUARTERS  WE SEE no sign of DeJesus.  Cobb follows into the room, looking carefully around for sign of DeJesus. In the mirror to Beck's bathroom, Cobb spots DeJesus pressing against the wall.  Cobb suddenly starts to sweat bullets.  Beck quickly unlocks the safe, opens it, and puts the videotape right next to the bottle of Vodka. We see Cobb's reaction.  Beck turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something wrong? Cobb shakes his head weakly and starts to follow Beck out, he sneaks a look back at DeJesus in the shadows who gives him a thumbs up. MESS - LATER Five specimen cups filled with vodka.  Bowman takes hers and looks at it questioningly.  Cobb watches the door for signs of the officers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cute, DeJesus...Specimen cups?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, loosen up, Bowman... (he looks over and notices Willie) Hey, Willie, I got one served up for you. Willie shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks.  I've got my blood tests in three days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all you do is exercise. You got to learn to live a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After my astronaut training physical, then I'll tie one on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget space cadet, I'll drink hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey what happens it he goes back and finds the bottle missing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won't... He holds up a plastic IV bag filled with clear liquid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I poured the vodka in here. Cobb, Jones, DeJesus, Bowman, and Sixpack grin and clink glasses, then knock back their vodka.  Afterwards we get their reactions. JONES:  Looks concerned. BOWMAN:  Shakes her head, something's wrong. DEJESUS:  Can't get the taste off his tongue. COBB:  Seems totally satisfied. SIXPACK:  who has held the liquid in his mouth savoring it, suddenly spits the vodka out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!  It's water!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beck switched it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you beat that?  The sonof- abitch doesn't trust us! Willie grins at her co-workers and Beck's move and jogs out into the corridor.  Sixpack disgustedly tosses his shot glass away and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That little turd.  If I ever get the chance I'll fix his ass. The others put down their glasses disappointedly except Bowman.  She watches Sixpack. DORMITORY SIXPACK'S BUNK  He closes his privacy door and hesitates as if listening for the others, then he removes a silver flask with Cyrillic lettering--the silver object he palmed in the Swamp--and smiles as he takes a long pull.  Suddenly WHAM! The Privacy door to Sixpack's bunk is slammed open. Startled he turns startled to see--BOWMAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't I ever tell you vodka was my favorite drink? She holds out her glass.  Sixpack looks around the Dorm, it's empty, then grins sheepishly and pours her a shot. CORRIDOR "B" ON WILLIE  She is jogging through the corridors.  Suddenly there is a GREAT GROANING NOISE.  Willie stops and looks through the steel mesh wall into the machine floor.  The dark shapes of the machines move monstrously in the dim light.  The GROANING ends and she jogs on to the Swamp. As she passes the door she notices the light and stops.  Beck stands with a clipboard by an equipment cabinet filled with the parachute-like Container Transporters we saw outside. He sees her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a loud one wasn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a month of it you'd think I'd be used to it. She moves into the Swamp and goes to the Lift Lock, stopping under one of the ladders she leaps up and grabs a metal rung above her and begins doing her chin-ups as Beck watches her lean body easily doing the exercises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's astronaut training?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?  You going to give me hard time like the others?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I'm just being friendly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good...It's going good. Beck tries to concentrate on his inventory, but continues to watch Willie's sexy, athletic body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever made you want to do a tour down here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need electrical field experience on my resume. Everything helps... (she watches him) Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody in corporate training serves a tour on the line.  Sup- posed to hone leadership skills or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has it helped? Beck shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess there's not a lot of adventure in the Control Room. Beck looks up and they lock eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I should hang around more with the crew?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I always heard you don't "learn" leadership, you earn it. (beat) How did you know they'd get into the vodka? Beck looks up from his clipboard and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I figured if I was in their shoes that's what I would've done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you're more one of us than you think...sir. INT. MESS/ BLACKBOARD - MORNING SCREECH!  The chalk shrieks across the blackboard, making a "1" over the words "Days Till Pickup." Jones looks up from his cereal at Bowman, the culprit with the chalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puuleeeeze... INT. DORMITORY - SAME DeJesus puts on his wet suit which goes under his large mechanical suit and gets ready to join the others in the mess.  He notices Sixpack's privacy door is still closed and bangs on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Sixpack...Rise and shine amigo... There is no answer.  Carefully he opens the door and is surprised to find it empty. INT. INFIRMARY - SAME CLOSE ON Sixpack's eye.  We pull back to see it is being examined by Doc who frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see your tongue. Sixpack obliges as Beck enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty good imitation of a hangover and I ought to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it ain't!  It feels a thousand times worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I dunno.  I just feel... wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take off your shirt. Sixpack pulls off his shirt.  Doc frowns in surprise. WHAT HE SEES:  SIXPACK'S TORSO  There are strange black areas, each of them an inch in diameter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long...how long have you had these?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, Doc...I didn't know I had them. Doc peers closely at the skin where it's discolored.  It's a different texture.  Beck watches as Doc touches a spot and Sixpack screams in agony.  Doc and Beck lock eyes. BECK'S QUARTERS - SAME CLOSE ON MARTIN on Beck's video monitor.  He is drinking a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...as long as you know it's not in your contract.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, suit yourself, then...its your decision... (he chuckles) Ha ha...a little joke...suit yourself... Beck interrupts impatiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's the weather for pickup tomorrow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beautiful. THE SWAMP - MORNING The crew members climb into their suits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad as he is there's no way we can make our quota with- out his sad self out there. You just can't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's tanking on us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...he's really sick.  I heard him last night.  The company will take that into consideration...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, the company don't give a flying fuck about "whys," they just look at the numbers and the contract says if we miss our quota they only got to pay us half-pay for the entire month.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cocksucker's tanking on us... Suddenly all eyes go to the door, Beck enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he's really sick...He won't be going out today. The crew increases its bitching...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There goes our quota...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty days, right down the toilet... Beck ignores them and goes to the control rack which sends the suits around the room and pushes number 8--his suit. DeJesus and Jones share a look.  Bowman and Willie watch him carefully.  As Beck's suit stops in front of him the room is quiet, they can't believe their eyes.  Awkwardly, Beck tries to get into his suit.  Cobb breaks the silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, sir...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this a contract violation, Mr. Cobb?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sir...I just wanted to know if you needed a hand? Beck sees he's sincere, then looks at the others and Willie. She nods slightly.  Beck turns back to Cobb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks... INT. THE INFIRMARY - SAME Doc and Sixpack.  Doc takes a blood sample, seals it and opens a cabinet under the sink where a supply of blood is stored in a refrigerated unit.  The plastic bags of blood are labeled with the various crew members' names. Sixpack watches him from the examination table.  He is shivering violently and scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Doc...I'm cold...I hurt... We see a change in Doc's demeanor.  He is suddenly needed and it has touched something in him and we see him rising to the challenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just going to take a tiny piece of skin to look at under the microscope...Afterwards I'll give you a sedative. Skillfully Doc takes a skin sample.  Sixpack screams. VIEW THROUGH THE MICROSCOPE An enlarged view of the cells in alarmingly hyperactivity. We see it literally spreading before our eyes. ON DOC He leans back from the microscope.  There is awe on his face for the first time since first year medical studies--and there is fear of the unknown.  He looks over his shoulder at Sixpack, his shivering has stopped, he lies still on the table. UNDERWATER Lights move in the blackness, but there is an order to the actions and a crispness to the voices.  People doing work that is moving sharply.  Pride in what they're doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, number 23's full.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get it out of here and bring in a new one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hook's on 24...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's have her... The Container transporters fill with compressed air and lift the container as the miners guide it to the track... INT. INFIRMARY/ SHACK - SAME Doc is at the console of his computer.  As words appear on the screen, obviously in response to his query... "...would appear to indicate a virus of unknown origin..." Doc shakes his head disgustedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No kidding?  "A virus of unknown origin."  Come on and tell me something I don't know... like what's going on... ON SCREEN More words come up.  "...no idea..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then take a guess, goddamnit! He finishes typing and waits for an answer.  The cursor flashes the word "PROCESSING".  Then an answer comes up. "Genetic Alteration?"  The words send a chill down Doc's spine. SWAMP ROOM - LATER The mood is happy.  Like a high school football locker room after a winning game.  DeJesus climbs out of his suit and slaps Beck on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good work out there, Mr. Becky. Beck, obviously pleased, looks at the others.  Jones sums up the feelings of the entire group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir. Beck's grin suddenly disappears at the sight of a flashing red light over the intercom. INFIRMARY - LATER Beck is standing in the doorway of the Infirmary, glaring at Doc, who sits with his bottle of Old Granddad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead?  This morning you said he had some skin disorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, how the hell does a skin rash kill you in eight hours?! Doc looks at Beck wearily and hands him a mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here.  Put this on.  You examine him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For this...you don't need to be. Beck hesitates, then puts on the mask. SICK ROOM As Beck enters, masked, Sixpack's back is to him under the sheets.  Slowly he pulls back the sheet and recoils from the sight.  The black splotches have nearly all grown together. His fingers have lengthened and become more webbed.  Most dramatically the sores on the sides of his neck have become flared and elongated.  Though not bleeding, the open veins are visible. INFIRMARY Doc pours some bourbon in a glass, and takes a sip.  Beck enters dazed from the sick room and their eyes meet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mask is because you think it might be...catching?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  I've been back and forth with Narragansett Naval all day, consulting with the best people in maritime medicine, the best people in viruses...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they didn't believe the symptoms I described...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why Sixpack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It could be a million things, something in the air, food.... (he looks up and locks eyes with Beck) But he went on that ship and so did Williams... (beat) I want to examine the crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...right... He starts to the door and Doc watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've reported the death to the company. INT. THE MESS - SAME The mess is quiet.  All eyes are down.  Sixpack's absence is noticeable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Routine," my ass!  Ain't nothin' "routine" about no physical check- up 10,000 feet down...especially when we're getting picked up the next day!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't say it was a "routine check-up," he said it was a "routine precaution ."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be bad.  Even sick Sixpack never missed a meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's this fucking air system....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't the food or the air system, he's just sick... Everybody gets sick every now and then.  It's all part of being human! Bowman suddenly becomes pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I must be human because I'm sure as hell sick. She gets up from the table and dashes for the toilet. INT. SHOWER ROOM - LATER EXAMINATION SEQUENCE CLOSE ON WHITE SKIN/(COBB) Pale skin, fishbelly white with white hairs, seen closely...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'm kinda...outta shape... (a pause, no answer) This skin condition...what is it? Like herpes, or measles, or what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's difficult to describe. Doc is scrutinizing Cobb's flabby body closely.  They're alone in the shower room.  Stainless steel, and mirrors.  Doc stops and checks a place on Cobb more closely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, it'd be a hell of a thing if I went back to the roof with some kind of herpes thing.  My wife wouldn't understand that at all... Doc peers closely, satisfies himself that it's nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seem all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wouldn't understand.  She'd think I was down here fucking my head off. DARK SKIN/ PORES  Black skin, seen very close, the pores appearing like craters. We're looking at Jones' naked body...rippling muscles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This whole thing's unnecessary, Doc. Only "skin problem" I got is white people... (beat, suspiciously) How come you're wearing those gloves? INT. SHOWER ROOM/ SMOOTH SKIN - LATER Firm, lovely breasts, smooth skin...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This disease...do you know what causes it? Doc turns Willie around and examines her firm naked buttocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet.  You got any ideas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't think it was from going on that ship do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a possibility.  But if it was that simple why haven't the symptoms begun on you? Doc turns away to let her dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean I'm okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fine. SHOWER ROOM/ TAN SKIN DeJesus' body is being examined...tan skin, wiry muscles seen very close.  As we move along the skin, it seems every moment as if the next instant will reveal a dread blemish...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, "a skin problem"... your skin changes? DeJesus, naked, with his back to us.  Doc examines him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It blackens...becomes scaly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean like a fish? DeJesus chuckles, but something about the thought stops Doc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...like a fish...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just joking, Doc. CONTROL ROOM - SAME Beck sits in his chair reading the TRANSOCEAN OFFICERS INSTRUCTIONAL MANUAL. INSERT:  The chapter he's on says:  BODY DISPOSAL AT SEA. The face of Martin stares back at us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, according to Maritime law, you, as commander of the Shack have the authority to dispose of the body.  However, the company doesn't want you to do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you don't understand is that my crew is in jeopardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you don't have any proof at this point to assume that this disease is contagious, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not anxious to find out, either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beck, trust me.  If the company felt that you or your crew were in any danger we would authorize an immediate emergency pickup. We could be there in a few hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately.  We can't. He picks up a sheet of computer paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a typhoon about 600 miles off the coast of Baja. It's not coming your way but the Company doesn't want to lose you folks or an emergency ship should it veer your way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you saying?  That we're not even going to be picked up tomorrow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It shouldn't be a long delay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's a delay!  How long? A day?  Two days?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twelve hours, no big deal.  We should know something first thing in the morning.  Don't worry. WASHROOM - SAME Willie enters the room with several sinks and a couple of toilet stalls.  She approaches one of the sinks and pulls a toothbrush from the pocket of her robe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bo?  Doc says you're next. Just then she hears a retching sound from one of the stalls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bo?...You okay? INFIRMARY - SAME Willie and Jones help Bowman into the Infirmary.  She is weak from nausea.  They help her onto the examination table and look around for Doc.  Jones sees a light on in the Sick Room. SICK ROOK - SAME Sixpack's body lies under a sheet in the Sick room.  The door opens and Jones looks in, sees Sixpack but in the dim light, doesn't realize the sheet covering him, covers the body totally.  Jones smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Sixpack...Hey, my man... How you feeling? There is no answer and Jones slowly approaches the body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, man, we made quota to- day.  No thanks to you, you dog, but we made it...Beck helped us...We just dropped Bowman off.  I hope what you've got ain't catching... He is almost to the table and reaches out to touch Sixpack when suddenly the body stirs.  Sixpack's foot moves slightly under the sheet as if shifting in his sleep.  Jones stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, man, sorry...you go back to sleep. INFIRMARY - SAME Jones returns to the examination room.  Bowman is now undressed and under the blankets on the examination table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who were you talking to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixpack...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleeping.  No sign of Doc, though.  I'll check the control room.  You look in the shower room... They leave Bowman GROANING on the examination table and head back to the main corridor.  As they leave WE HOLD ON the door to the sick room behind Bowman. Bowman writhes on the examination table in pain.  Carefully she climbs off the table and goes behind a partition to throw up. CLOSE ON BOWMAN At the sink in the infirmary.  She rinses her face in the sink and pulls back her hair, suddenly she stops and brings her hands in front of her face. INSERT HER HANDS.  Huge clumps of hair have come out in her hands.  And then she sees her hands themselves.  Scaly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God...what's going on? She turns and looks at the light on in the Sick Room.  Slowly she goes to the door and enters. SICK ROOM Bowman approaches the body of Sixpack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixpack...what's going on? No answer.  She pulls back the sheet and gasps. CONTROL ROOM - SAME ON BECK AND DOC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to call them back. Explain that this is an emergency. Jones enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, sir...Bowman's sick.  She's downstairs in the infirmary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The infirmary?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir, ain't that where we usually go when we're sick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're simply concerned about her...proximity to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixpack's dead. Jones looks from one officer to the other then grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit...I was just talking to him.  I saw him move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?... LOWER RING CORRIDOR - SAME Beck hits the floor off the ladder and rushes to the Infirmary with Jones.  He opens the door and freezes. WHAT HE SEES:  The examination table where Jones left her is empty.  The room deserted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I left her here. DOC comes up behind them, then turns.  He hears to a HISSING SOUND down the ring corridor.  He turns from the others and moves slowly toward the noise. SHOWER ROOM Doc enters the shower room, full of steam and the SOUND OF WATER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bowman? There is no answer and he moves toward the shower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bowman.  It's Doc.  I'm here to help you. The water continues to run.  No answer.  Carefully, Doc opens the shower door. WHAT HE SEES:  Bowman.  Dead.  Her wrists have been cut and blood swirls down the drain. Doc sadly squats down beside her.  The death effects him greatly.  He feels helpless, then suddenly his eyes widen and he carefully reaches out and takes Bowman's limp arm, turning it supine.  There, running the length of the arm, WE SEE the black scales. INFIRMARY Jones and Beck lay Bowman's body carefully onto the examination table in the infirmary.  Through the Sick Room door we see the sheet shrouded body of Sixpack.  Doc covers Bowman with a sheet as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The remaining crew, Doc, and Beck assembled in the Mess. Doc sits quietly, almost in a daze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't tell you much about it, except that none of you show any symptoms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it killed Bo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...she killed herself. ON WILLIE  the news hits her hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're getting out of here just in time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's now a problem with the weather for pickup.  There's a typhoon in our sector... ...We're going to be delayed twelve hours...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Typhoon?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twelve hours!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least we get time and a half.  That's in the contract.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck double pay, man!  I want out of here! Their argument is suddenly cut short by a NOISE from the corridor.  A THUMP!  The crew stops their grumbling and listens.  A moment later we hear another THUMP!  Beck looks at Jones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jones... (to the others) Stay here. RING CORRIDOR Beck leads the way slowly toward the Infirmary where the sound is coming from.  Outside the door they hear it once more.  THUMP! Carefully he enters the Infirmary and WE SEE the examination table is empty!  Beck goes to the Sick room and stops in the doorway.  Jones moves behind him and his eyes suddenly widen. WHAT THEY SEE:  Both bodies now are in a motionless, hideous conglomeration on the the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Cobb...you're slacking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't, goddamnit...It's Jones!.. Before Jones can argue, Beck cuts them off.
direction.name: direction
